member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.ContinuousInputDaqComponent`2
member.summary: Specifies the base class for continuous input DAQ components.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of reader the component uses to read data from the task.
Specifies the type of data that the component reads from the task.

remarks.para: is the base class for all continuous input DAQ components that are generated by the DAQ Assistant. It provides common members that are available to all continuous input DAQ components, regardless of measurement type.

begins the continuous input acquisition.
ends the continuous input read acquisition. Data is returned through a DataReady event on the generated component.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.InputDaqComponent`2
member.summary: Specifies the base class for input DAQ components, including finite and continuous input.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of reader the component uses to read data from the task.
Specifies the type of data that the component reads from the task.

remarks.para: is the base class for all input DAQ components that are generated by the DAQ Assistant. It provides common members that are available to all input DAQ components, regardless of timing or measurement type.

provides a reference to the reader that the component uses to read data from the task.
specifies if the reader has been created.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent
member.summary: Specifies the base class for DAQ components that provide a custom API for a configured DAQ task.

remarks.para: is the base class for all DAQ components that are generated by the DAQ Assistant. It provides common members that are available to all DAQ components, regardless of timing or measurement type.

provides a reference to the underlying task of the component. and are raised immediately before and after the task is started. and are raised immediately before and after the task is stopped. is raised when an error occurs in the task.
specifies if the task has been created. specifies if the task has been started.

member.summary: Creates the underlying DAQ task of the component.
member.returns: A that represents the DAQ task of the component.

remarks.para: calls to create the DAQ task of the component. The default implementation returns a new . Override to return a task from or a -derived class that has been generated by the DAQ Assistant.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.CommitTask
member.summary: Programs the DAQ hardware with all parameters of the task.
member.remarks: calls with the mode set to on the component DAQ task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources used by .
member.param: If , this method releases managed and unmanaged resources. If , this method releases only unmanaged resources.

remarks.para: disposes the DAQ task of the component if it has been created.
The public method and the finalizer call this method.The public invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with set to . The finalizer invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with set to .
When you set the parameter to , this method releases all resources held by managed objects that this references. This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.Initialize
member.summary: Performs additional component initialization when the component is constructed.
member.remarks: The component source file that is generated by the DAQ Assistant must contain the default constructor of the component in order to be immediately droppable in a Visual Studio designer without building the project. Therefore, the default constructor of components that are generated by the DAQ Assistant contains a call to . You can override in the user partial class of the component definition to perform additional initialization at component construction time.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.AutoCommitTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if the task is committed when the component is initialized.
member.value: if the task is committed when the component is initialized. The default value is .
member.remarks: Set to at design time to specify that is automatically called when the component is initialized, such as when the containing form loads. This moves the overhead of committing the task from when the first DAQ operation is performed to the when the application initializes.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.IsTaskStarted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the component DAQ task has been started.
member.value: if the component DAQ task has been started. The default value is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.IsTaskCreated
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the component DAQ task has been created.
member.value: if the component DAQ task has been created. The default value is .
member.remarks: does not create the DAQ task until it is needed. Use to check if the DAQ task has already been created rather than comparing to . Accessing causes the DAQ task to be created if it is not already created.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ComponentModel.DaqComponent.Task
member.summary: Gets the underlying DAQ task of the component.
member.value: A that represents the underlying DAQ task of the component.
member.remarks: If the underlying DAQ task has not already been created, calls to create the underlying DAQ task; therefore, use to check if the task has already been created rather than comparing to . When calls to create the DAQ task, raises the event.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the component is being disposed.
member.value: if the component is being disposed.

stops the DAQ task of the component.

member.summary: Performs a synchronous read operation and returns the acquired data.

and then calls
to perform the synchronous read operation and retrieve the acquired data. If
automatically starts the task, it will automatically call to stop the task after the read operation is complete.
